snippet: The Allstate Insurance Company said today that it had agreed to issue $110 million in rebates to California customers to comply with the state's rate rollback required under Proposition 103.   The rebates would average $66 for each auto policy, $2...
lead_paragraph: The Allstate Insurance Company said today that it had agreed to issue $110 million in rebates to California customers to comply with the state's rate rollback required under Proposition 103. The rebates would average $66 for each auto policy, $26 for each homeowner policy and $206 for commercial policies, or about 5 percent of the annual premium, Allstate said.
